Name: Stela of Khenmes
Description: The lunette contains fifteen columns of carved hieroglyphs, with the offering formula. The rest of the decorated surface of the stela is divided into four registers. The uppermost register depicts a man seated on the left on a chair with leonine legs. In front of him is a low offering table and a man with two kneeling women behind him. There are inscriptions above the heads of the two women. In each of the other three registers are five people accompanied by inscriptions, all of them kneeling except for one standing figure in the third and fourth registers. The figures have some internal detail. The figure at bottom left has been completely carved out of the stone.
